data.title: change numbers and letters
data.solution:
import re

n = input()
check = lambda x: str(ord(x.group(0))) if x.group(0).isalpha() else chr(int(x.group(0)))
print(re.sub('([a-zA-Z]|[0-9]+)', check, n))
data.statement:
You have space-separated 10 strings [[n]].
Each string of [[n]] is either a number or a letter in upper or lower case. You need to replace letters with their ASCII-codes and numbers with corresponding letter from the ASCII table.

data.constraints:
Letters contains upper and lower case.
the number is ASCII. So 97<=number<=122 or 65<=number<=90.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> space-separated 10 strings [[n]] for numbers and letters.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> space-separated 10 replaced numbers or replaced letters.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have space-separated 10 strings n.
Each string of n is either a number or a letter in upper or lower case. You need to replace letters with their ASCII-codes and numbers with corresponding letter from the ASCII table.
Input
Line 1: space-separated 10 strings n for numbers and letters.
Output
Line 1: space-separated 10 replaced numbers or replaced letters.
Constraints
Letters contains upper and lower case.
the number is ASCII. So 97<=number<=122 or 65<=number<=90.
Example
Input
101 118 w 122 97 77 72 71 65 75
Output
e v 119 z a M H G A K
